short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Is your child Minecraft mad?

Turn that love of playing games into a passion for creating them with our four-day modding masterclass.

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

Students will learn how to make their own awesome Minecraft mods throughout the week of creeper smashing, world building and sheep shooting fun. We’ll be using JavaScript and the Blockly programming languages to code and create our own items, weapons, mobs, and games while improving our programming skills.

We’ll learn how to use loops, functions, variables, and conditionals to make a fun summer themed mini-game, complete with our own modded items, mobs, and skins. We’ll also learn how to administer and use JavaScript commands on our own private servers.

This course will challenge our beginner modders ans well as the master modders as lots of challenges and extensions await everyone as they progress throughout the week. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Don’t just leave your child to play Minecraft – get them to create it!

What is Blockly?

Blockly is a graphical block-based programming language designed to ease the transition from Scratch to Javascript. We use blockly as it allows students to get the coding right away without having to worry about making small syntax errors that can frustrate students when they first start to code in JavaScript.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered:

– Fundamentals of Blockly

– Programming with JavaScript

– Logic and conditionals

– Game design and graphics

– Story development

Pre-requisites

Students should be at least a bit familiar with Scratch and may have started to learn Javascript at school or at one of our after-school clubs. They should have played Minecraft before and have sufficient typing and mouse skills.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

Logins and Software: All students should have a working version of Minecraft on their laptops and they will require a purchased account from https://minecraft.net/en

Logins are available to hire for the period of the camp but your child will not be able to use them afterward.

LearnToMod accounts for the use at camp are included in the price.

For more information about LearnToMod please go to https://login-thoughtstem.herokuapp.com/

Please make sure that the laptop your child is bringing is able to run Minecraft and LearnToMod to avoid any technical delays.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!

name: Minecraft Modding

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Boost your child’s creativity and set them on their next engineering journey!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description:

During this 4 day camp, your child will get to release their inner engineer and design awesome robots using Lego Mindstorms equipment and software. Students will work in teams to build their very own robots and develop critical thinking, problem-solving and basic engineering skills by modifying and troubleshooting their creations. They will integrate programming and sensor technology to make their robots move, react and solve challenges. LEGO Mindstorms helps build science, technology, and maths (STEM) knowledge while incorporating lessons in language arts and boosting your child’s creativity.

We will also be learning how to create our very own 3D models by bringing our digital creations to the real world with our 3D printers. Children will learn how to turn a basic geometric shape into an actual object – anything from simple 3D objects to planes or dragons! Your child will boost their digital modelling skills and increase their creativity.

This is a highly creative hands-on course, and your child will be challenged while having an amazing engineering adventure. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics Covered

– Engineering concepts

– Construction fundamentals

– Programming challenges

– How do sensors work

– How does a robot solve problems

– Gears and motors

– 3D modeling techniques

– Creative problem-solving

– 3D Printing

– Digital Sculpting

Pre-requisites

Students should be familiar with programming languages (like JavaScript or Bitsbox) and have experience with basic robotics (Lego WeDo or similar). Ideally, students have been learning programming in school and/or completed our coding and robotics course.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Exploring Robotics and 3D Printing

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Advance your child’s Coding and Robotics skills this summer!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

Our Senior Coders will be honing their coding skills as they are introduced to new concepts and tools!

We will teach the all-important touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games and competing in exciting challenges.

This course will introduce students to a text-based language JavaScript, one of the web’s most ubiquitous coding languages, and give students a head start into programming industry. Not only will they learn invaluable skills such as critical and logical thinking, problem-solving, and numeracy, but they will get to have lots of fun! JavaScript is one of the most popular languages in games developing and we will tackle it from every angle. We will build our own games and learn how to incorporate various stimulations. We will also use JavaScript to learn about robots.

We will also spend some time learning Bitsbox – our all-time favourite programming language, where we will learn how to create games, apps, and programme robots!

Lastly, we will tackle processing, where even our most advanced coders will be challenged. Processing will allow students to learn the basics of computer programming in a visual context, and will introduce them to P5.js coding language.

By the end of the course, students will be able to create their own Java projects, sufficiently use Bitsbox, and be familiar with the fundamentals of processing. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered

– Intermediate coding concepts: loops, variables, conditionals and functions

– Mathematical concepts: coordinates, angles, and operations

– Robotics: using input and output device

– Electronics concepts: resistance, voltage, and current

– Introduction to JavaScript

– Games development

– Programme design

– Introduction to processing and P5.js

– Fundamentals of Bitsbox

– Touch-typing

Pre-requisites

This is a course for intermediate coders aged 9 – 12. Students should be proficient in using the computer – comfortable using both the mouse and keyboard. They should also have experience using a coding language such as Scratch.

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

value.meta_description: A games programming course where we will teach children coding with JavaScript. This is an intermediate course perfect for children ages 9 - 12.

name: JavaScript and Robotics Immersive

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Let your young master coders shine this summer!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description

Our master coders  will be learning Python, one of the most commonly used programming languages, especially favoured by academic institutions. It is a higher-level coding language, therefore this course will help aspiring young game designers to get ahead in the industry.

Students will be developing their own games – writing their own code, learning game design concepts and adding animations. While building games, we will also  get creative with loops, functions, conditional structures, and physics that will enhance their programming skills. Will you create an epic RPG, a side-scrolling shooter, or a classic arcade hit, we’ll teach you all the skills you need to start your adventure in games development.

Students will also tackle advanced robotics, where they will learn how to build and programme their robots.

We will also teach the all-important touch typing, a key skill in any programmer’s life. Coders will find their way around the keyboard playing fun typing games and competing in exciting challenges.

During this course, students will create complex games, develop engineering and web design skills, and get to incorporate industry-used algorithms to their work. These course will be an invaluable experience that will boost your child’s career prospects in the future. In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered:

– Advanced coding concepts: loops, variables, conditionals and functions

– Game logic

– Game design and 2D graphics

– Story development

– Writing code

– Algorithm design and development

– Procedural programming

– Fundamentals of Python

– Advanced robotics

– App development

– Touch-typing

Pre-requisites

This is an advanced course for students aged 9 – 12. Students should have sufficient experience using different coding languages.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

value.meta_description: A games programming camp where we will teach students to code using Python. This is an intermediate course for children ages 9 - 12.

name: Games Programming with Python

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Get your child to become the next web or app developer

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 4 pm.

Course Description:

This course will introduce children to fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We will learn how to design our own avatars, develop responsive web pages, and create our own  interactive websites. HTML and CSS languages are used to develop and design websites, and we will teach you invaluable skills that will come in handy in the future.

We will also incorporate JavaScript into adding sliders, animations and other fun features that will improve your website development skills even further. Using JavaScript, we will also build interactive apps and put the kids on the path of app development.

Website  and app development is an invaluable skill that will help your child to complete the National Computing Curriculum as well as make them much more hireable in the future. Plus, it is a lot of fun! In one week, your child will learn more than most kids do during the whole school year.

Achievements and outcomes

Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp and share it with you through Class Dojo – an app which allows you to see photos of your child’s work, be involved in your child’s progress and message the teachers directly if you have any questions. The children will also receive a certificate of completion on the final day. They will also leave with their own unique website that they have created during the week.

Topics Covered

– Fundamentals of HTML

– Fundamentals of CSS

– Creating avatars

– Using code to design websites

– Edit and change web pages

– Problem solving and troubleshooting

– Creating animations and pop-up galleries

– Creating their very own website

– Using JavaScript to enhance their page

– Building apps using JavaScript

– Breaking a professional design into code

– Using the Web responsibly

Pre-requisites

This is an intermediate course for students aged 9 – 12. Students should have used Scratch or other programming languages before.

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (no nuts please!) We will provide a snack and water during the day.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Web Development with HTML, CSS and JavaScript

short_description:
Book before 30th June for an Early Bird special price!

 

Enrol your child in a course that will give them a life-long skill as well as bring joy!

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10 am to 12 pm.

Course Description:

Since computers have become a central part of every child and adult’s day, it is essential to teach them how to use them properly. With so much time spend on the screen, it is important to make sure that your child holds the correct posture and the right way of using the keyboard in order to keep them healthy and make them efficient in the future.

If a week of typing sounds a bit dull – worry not! Children will be learning these essential skills in the format of games, where they will compete against each other, win prizes, and definitely have lots of fun!

Touch Typing is becoming one of the most requested classes, so don’t miss out on the fun learning.

Pre-requisites

This is a course for all levels for children aged 6 – 13.

Laptop Policy: For this class, we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however, this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9 am available every day! 9 am – 10 am arrival on the first day of camp (Monday).

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

name: Touch Typing Intensive

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Let your young master coders shine this summer!

Our most advanced coding course this summer holiday camp. Students should have sufficient experience using different coding languages.

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10am to 4pm.

Course Description

Our Elders will be making their own retro games using JavaScript,  and designing controllers with Arduino. They will get to grips with text-based programming with the industry standard language JavaScript.

We’ll be getting creative with loops, functions, libraries, graphics, and physics while learning the programming language favoured by industry.

Will you create an epic RPG, a side-scrolling shooter, or a classic arcade hit, we’ll
teach you all the skills you need to start your adventure in games development.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you through Class Dojo and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Topics covered:
Advanced coding concepts: loops, variables, conditionals and functions
Game logic, level design, 2D graphics, and story development
Touch typing: an important skill as we become masters in text-based coding

Laptop Policy: For this class we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however this is subject to availability.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day! Early drop off is offered to everybody for the first day of camp (Monday).

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!

name: April Holiday Camp: Robotics and Coding Level 3

short_description:
Book before 31st May for an Early Bird special price!

 

Is your child ready to take their Minecraft skills to the next level? 

Discover how to make your own awesome Minecraft mods over four days of creeper smashing, world building and sheep shooting fun. We’ll be using the Blockly programming environment to code and create our own items, weapons, mobs and games while improving our programming skills.

We’ll learn how to use loops, functions, variables, and conditionals to make a fun summer themed mini-game, complete with our own modded items, mobs, and skins. We’ll also learn how to administer and use Javascript commands on our own private servers.

Classes are held Monday – Thursday from 10am to 4pm.

What is blockly?

Blockly is a graphical block based programming language designed to ease the transition from
Scratch to Javascript. We use blockly as it allows students to get coding right away
without having to worry about making small syntax errors that can frustrate students when
they first start to code in Javascript.

Achievements and outcomes
Our teachers will actively record your child’s work throughout the camp to share with you through Class Dojo and the children will receive a certificate of completion on the final day.

Pre-requisites
Students should be confident in Scratch and may have started to learn Javascript at school or at one of our after-school clubs. They should have played Minecraft before and have good typing and mouse skills.

Laptop Policy: For this class we operate a ‘bring your own laptop’ policy. If this is not possible, we do offer laptop hire, however this is subject to availability.

Logins and Software: All students should have a working version of Minecraft on their laptops and they will require a purchased account from https://minecraft.net/en
Logins are available to hire for the period of the camp but your child will not be able to use them afterwards. LearnToMod accounts are included in the price of the camp for the use at camp.

For more information about LearnToMod please go to https://login-thoughtstem.herokuapp.com/

Please make sure that the laptop your child is bringing is able to run Minecraft and LearnToMod to avoid any technical delays.

‘Early drop off‘ at 9am available every day! Early drop off is offered to everybody for the first day of camp (Monday).

Students should bring a packed lunch with them (not nuts please!) We will provide a snack in the morning.

Single day attendance is available, please contact us on hello@blueshiftcoding.com

Unsure if this class is suitable for your child? Call us for advice!
